docs.snippet: MAPPING routes, shopping, packing are the least of European travelers' worries these days. The big problems are first, catching your reservations and second, complying with inoculation requirements.

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly, holding its last full session at Flushing Meadow for the time being, instructed its Political and Security Committee yesterday to give the Jewish Agency for Palestine a hearing on the British proposal to establish...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly, holding its last full session at Flushing Meadow for the time being, instructed its Political and Security Committee yesterday to give the Jewish Agency for Palestine a hearing on the British proposal to establish a committee of inquiry into the Palestine question.

docs.snippet: The people of the United States have learned to abandon political isolationism but many still cling to economic isolationism, a form of international thinking that can lead to a world economic collapse and war instead of peace. Warren R. Austin,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The people of the United States have learned to abandon political isolationism but many still cling to economic isolationism, a form of international thinking that can lead to a world economic collapse and war instead of peace. Warren R. Austin, United States representative to the United Nations, said last night.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, May 6 -- The battle over representation on the United Nations Committee of Inquiry on Palestine will begin here tomorrow. The General Assembly's Political Committee will be faced with a choice between excluding the Big Five or insisting...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, May 6 -- The battle over representation on the United Nations Committee of Inquiry on Palestine will begin here tomorrow. The General Assembly's Political Committee will be faced with a choice between excluding the Big Five or insisting that the major powers share responsibility for the investigation.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N. Y., May 7 --Faced with the threat of an Arab boycott of its proceedings regarding the Palestine question, the United Nations General Asembly held an emergency session this afternoon and gave recognition to the Arab Higher Committee...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N. Y., May 7 --Faced with the threat of an Arab boycott of its proceedings regarding the Palestine question, the United Nations General Asembly held an emergency session this afternoon and gave recognition to the Arab Higher Committee corresponding to the recognition previously accorded to the Jewish Agency for Palestine.

headline.main: EXTRA SITTING HELD; Arab Higher Committee Wins Status Equal to Jewish Agency's VOTE 39 TO 1; 11 ABSTAIN Resolution Drafted by Britain in Face of Moslem Threat to Boycott Meeting BID TO ARABS VOTED BY U. N. ASSEMBLY ON HAND FOR THE UNITED NATIONS SESSION AT LAKE SUCCESS

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 8 -- Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union said today that the Big Five should shoulder their responsibility for the fate of Palestine through all stages of the United Nations work on the problem. He argued that there was "no...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 8 -- Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union said today that the Big Five should shoulder their responsibility for the fate of Palestine through all stages of the United Nations work on the problem. He argued that there was "no justification" for the United States and Britain's opposition to being included in the peace organization's Palestine inquiry committee.

headline.main: RUSSIANS EAGER TO JOIN IN INQUIRY; Gromyko Rejects U.S., British, Chinese Thesis That Big 5 Stay Off Committee
